channel.title: Google-Drive on Tinkering with Linux
channel.description: Recent content in Google-Drive on Tinkering with Linux

item.title: Syncing using rclone
item.description: I have been a Dropbox user for over a decade. Part of the attraction for me was that it is one of the few synchronization services that fully supports Linux. I had it installed on two servers, my office desktop, my laptop, and most of my mobile devices. Couple of years ago, my employer moved most of its IT services with Microsoft 365, which gives me access to storage space on Microsoft OneDrive as well. Plus, I have purchased additional storage on Google (for backing up my personal photos). But I never seriously used Microsoft OneDrive or Google Drive for synchronization because all my computers run Linux and neither of these services had a Linux client.
